MS MCQs

    Automate Java container deployments with Azure Pipelines - How do Azure and Azure DevOps support Java applications?

    »

    1. What kind of source changes will the typical Java project require in order to run on Azure?

      Java apps will need to be rewritten in C# or another .NET language before they will run properly on Azure.

      Configuration code will have to be rewritten to connect to Azure’s configuration service.

      No changes are required.


    2. How does hosting Java apps on Azure differ from hosting apps built for other platforms (like .NET) on Azure?

      Each app platform has its own dependencies, so developers need to be sure the Azure target they’re using is configured correctly.

      Java deployments require use of Java performance and monitoring tools.

      Java deployments are limited to web sites on Azure.


    3. What databases can a Java app deployed on Azure connect to?

      Azure SQL Database is the only option.

      Azure Database for MySQL is the only option.

      They can connect to any database or service.
